content.user_title: Build Claude Code slash commands fast
content.value_statement: Teams struggle to standardize Claude Code slash commands and avoid broken arguments. This skill provides clear structures, frontmatter options, and tested patterns for reliable commands.
actual_capabilities: Explain slash command file structure and locations
Document YAML frontmatter fields and usage
Guide dynamic arguments with $ARGUMENTS and $1 patterns
limitations: Does not execute or validate commands in your environment
Does not install plugins or modify files automatically
No external network access or third party API calls
Guidance depends on current Claude Code command features

use_cases.title: Standardize team commands
use_cases.description: Create consistent project commands with descriptions, arguments, and safe tool scopes.

use_cases.title: Design plugin commands
use_cases.description: Build plugin commands that use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} and integrate scripts, templates, and agents.

use_cases.title: Quick workflow automation
use_cases.description: Set up personal slash commands for review, docs, and testing tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic command
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a basic slash command for code review. Provide file name, frontmatter, and prompt body. Use Read and Bash(git:*) only.

prompt_templates.title: Argument command
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a command that reviews a specific file path argument. Include argument-hint and use @ syntax with $1.

prompt_templates.title: Plugin command
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a plugin command that runs a script with ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}. Include allowed-tools and error handling notes.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a multi phase command that runs tests, loads a template, and generates a report. Specify frontmatter and clear steps.

output_examples.input: Create a slash command that documents a file by path and uses only Read tool.
output: - Suggested file name and command name
- Note to keep allowed-tools as Read only

best_practices: Use clear descriptions and document arguments with argument-hint
Limit allowed-tools to the minimal required scope
Prefer project relative paths and @ references for files
anti_patterns: Writing commands as messages to users instead of instructions for Claude
Allowing Bash(*) when specific scopes are sufficient
Skipping argument validation for required inputs

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets Claude Code slash commands and is suitable for Codex workflows that follow similar patterns.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only. It does not run commands, access your files, or validate results automatically.

faq.question: Can it integrate with plugin scripts and templates?
faq.answer: Yes. It documents ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} usage and plugin command patterns.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is local documentation and does not require network access.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot missing commands?
faq.answer: Check file location, .md extension, valid frontmatter, and restart Claude Code.

faq.question: How does it compare to general prompt guidance?
faq.answer: It focuses on slash command structure, frontmatter fields, and execution patterns specific to Claude Code.
